none: Northwestern vs. Minnesota and Northwestern vs. Purdue
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music

Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1983 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Minnesota Gophers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Pregame performances begin with the University of Minnesota Marching Band performing "Go, Go for Victory" and "Minnesota Rouser." The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by Dale Lonis, performs the National Anthem, "Minnesota Rouser," and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances by the University of Minnesota Marching Band include "What a Feeling (Theme from Flashdance)" and "Truly" by Lionel Ritchie. The Northwestern University Marching Band performs "Give My Regards to Broadway" and "What a Feeling (Theme from Flashdance)." As the Homecoming court is announced, the band plays "Memory." The NUMB Alums join the band to play "Stars and Stripes Forever." Finally, John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Purdue Boilermakers in West Lafayette, Indiana. Pregame performance by the Northwestern Marching Band include "Hail Purdue," "She Works Hard for the Money," and "Go U Northwestern." The Purdue University All-American Marching Band performs "Go U Northwestern," "Hail Purdue," the National Anthem, "America the Beautiful," and "Back Home Again in Indiana." Halftime performances by the Northwestern Marching Band include "Stars and Stripes Forever" and "Go U Northwestern." The Purdue Marching Band performs "Come Back to Me," "Muskrat Ramble," "Ta-Ra-Ra Boom-Dey-Ay," and "Hail Purdue." Postgame performances by both bands include "Hail Purdue," "Go U Northwestern," "What a Feeling (Theme from Flashdance)," "Salsation," "The Charleston," "Muskrat Ramble," "I Got the Music in Me," music from "Winds of War," "Fame," "For the Honor of Old Purdue," and "Alma Mater."

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
